meanings.definition: To construct a canal or canals.
meanings.sent1: The workers canalled the river to make it easier for boats to pass through.
meanings.sent2: The engineers canalled the land to connect the two bodies of water.
meanings.sent3: The beavers canalled their own waterway through the forest, much to the surprise of the hikers.
meanings.sent4: She canalled her way through the dense crowd, determined to reach the stage.
meanings.sent5: The ants canalled a path through the sand, carrying food back to their nest.

meanings.definition: To navigate through a canal or canals.
meanings.sent1: The ship canalled through the Panama Canal, saving time on its journey.
meanings.sent2: The tour boat canalled smoothly through the historic waterway, offering scenic views to the passengers.
meanings.sent3: The ducks canalled through the narrow canal, quacking happily as they swam along.
meanings.sent4: He canalled his way through the busy traffic, expertly maneuvering his bicycle.
meanings.sent5: The fish canalled swiftly through the underwater passage, escaping from a larger predator.
